verses.text_plain: Now Pashur the son of Immer the priest, who was also chief governor in the house of the Lord, heard that Jeremiah prophesied these things.
verses.verse_html: 1Now Pashur the son of Immer the priest, who was also chief governor in the house of the Lord, heard that Jeremiah prophesied these things.

verses.text_plain: Then Pashur smote Jeremiah the prophet, and put him in the stocks that were in the high gate of Benjamin, which was by the house of the Lord.
verses.verse_html: 2Then Pashur smote Jeremiah the prophet, and put him in the stocks that were in the high gate of Benjamin, which was by the house of the Lord.

verses.text_plain: And it came to pass on the morrow, that Pashur brought forth Jeremiah out of the stocks. Then said Jeremiah unto him, The Lord hath not called thy name Pashur, but Magor–missabib.
verses.verse_html:
3And it came to pass on the morrow, that Pashur brought forth Jeremiah out of the stocks. Then said Jeremiah unto him, The Lord hath not called thy name Pashur, but Magor–missabib. ▼
▼ Magor–missabib: that is, Fear round about

tokens.text: And it came to pass on the morrow

footnotes.body_text: ▼ Magor–missabib: that is, Fear round about
footnotes.body_html: ▼ Magor–missabib: that is, Fear round about

verses.text_plain: For thus saith the Lord, Behold, I will make thee a terror to thyself, and to all thy friends: and they shall fall by the sword of their enemies, and thine eyes shall behold it: and I will give all Judah into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he shall carry them captive into Babylon, and shall slay them with the sword.
verses.verse_html: 4For thus saith the Lord, Behold, I will make thee a terror to thyself, and to all thy friends: and they shall fall by the sword of their enemies, and thine eyes shall behold it: and I will give all Judah into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he shall carry them captive into Babylon, and shall slay them with the sword.

tokens.text: to thyself, and to all thy friends
and he shall carry them captive

verses.text_plain: Moreover I will deliver all the strength of this city, and all the labours thereof, and all the precious things thereof, and all the treasures of the kings of Judah will I give into the hand of their enemies, which shall spoil them, and take them, and carry them to Babylon.
verses.verse_html: 5Moreover I will deliver all the strength of this city, and all the labours thereof, and all the precious things thereof, and all the treasures of the kings of Judah will I give into the hand of their enemies, which shall spoil them, and take them, and carry them to Babylon.

tokens.text: thereof, and all the precious things

verses.text_plain: And thou, Pashur, and all that dwell in thine house shall go into captivity: and thou shalt come to Babylon, and there thou shalt die, and shalt be buried there, thou, and all thy friends, to whom thou hast prophesied lies.
verses.verse_html: 6And thou, Pashur, and all that dwell in thine house shall go into captivity: and thou shalt come to Babylon, and there thou shalt die, and shalt be buried there, thou, and all thy friends, to whom thou hast prophesied lies.

tokens.text: there, thou, and all thy friends

verses.text_plain: O Lord, thou hast deceived me, and I was deceived: thou art stronger than I, and hast prevailed: I am in derision daily, every one mocketh me.
verses.verse_html:
7O Lord, thou hast deceived me, and I was deceived: thou art stronger than I, and hast prevailed: I am in derision daily, every one mocketh me. ▼
▼ was deceived: or, was enticed

footnotes.body_html: ▼ was deceived: or, was enticed

verses.text_plain: For since I spake, I cried out, I cried violence and spoil; because the word of the Lord was made a reproach unto me, and a derision, daily.
verses.verse_html: 8For since I spake, I cried out, I cried violence and spoil; because the word of the Lord was made a reproach unto me, and a derision, daily.

verses.text_plain: Then I said, I will not make mention of him, nor speak any more in his name. But his word was in mine heart as a burning fire shut up in my bones, and I was weary with forbearing, and I could not stay.
verses.verse_html: 9Then I said, I will not make mention of him, nor speak any more in his name. But his word was in mine heart as a burning fire shut up in my bones, and I was weary with forbearing, and I could not stay.

verses.text_plain: For I heard the defaming of many, fear on every side. Report, say they, and we will report it. All my familiars watched for my halting, saying, Peradventure he will be enticed, and we shall prevail against him, and we shall take our revenge on him.
verses.verse_html:
10For I heard the defaming of many, fear on every side. Report, say they, and we will report it. All my familiars watched for my halting, saying, Peradventure he will be enticed, and we shall prevail against him, and we shall take our revenge on him. ▼
▼ All…: Heb. Every man of my peace

tokens.text: against him, and we shall take

footnotes.body_text: ▼ All…: Heb. Every man of my peace
footnotes.body_html: ▼ All…: Heb. Every man of my peace

verses.text_plain: But the Lord is with me as a mighty terrible one: therefore my persecutors shall stumble, and they shall not prevail: they shall be greatly ashamed; for they shall not prosper: their everlasting confusion shall never be forgotten.
verses.verse_html: 11But the Lord is with me as a mighty terrible one: therefore my persecutors shall stumble, and they shall not prevail: they shall be greatly ashamed; for they shall not prosper: their everlasting confusion shall never be forgotten.

verses.text_plain: But, O Lord of hosts, that triest the righteous, and seest the reins and the heart, let me see thy vengeance on them: for unto thee have I opened my cause.
verses.verse_html: 12But, O Lord of hosts, that triest the righteous, and seest the reins and the heart, let me see thy vengeance on them: for unto thee have I opened my cause.

tokens.text: on them: for unto thee have I opened

verses.text_plain: Sing unto the Lord, praise ye the Lord: for he hath delivered the soul of the poor from the hand of evildoers.
verses.verse_html: 13Sing unto the Lord, praise ye the Lord: for he hath delivered the soul of the poor from the hand of evildoers.

verses.text_plain: Cursed be the day wherein I was born: let not the day wherein my mother bare me be blessed.
verses.verse_html: 14Cursed be the day wherein I was born: let not the day wherein my mother bare me be blessed.

verses.text_plain: Cursed be the man who brought tidings to my father, saying, A man child is born unto thee; making him very glad.
verses.verse_html: 15Cursed be the man who brought tidings to my father, saying, A man child is born unto thee; making him very glad.

verses.text_plain: And let that man be as the cities which the Lord overthrew, and repented not: and let him hear the cry in the morning, and the shouting at noontide;
verses.verse_html: 16And let that man be as the cities which the Lord overthrew, and repented not: and let him hear the cry in the morning, and the shouting at noontide;

verses.text_plain: Because he slew me not from the womb; or that my mother might have been my grave, and her womb to be always great with me.
verses.verse_html: 17Because he slew me not from the womb; or that my mother might have been my grave, and her womb to be always great with me.

verses.text_plain: Wherefore came I forth out of the womb to see labour and sorrow, that my days should be consumed with shame?
verses.verse_html: 18Wherefore came I forth out of the womb to see labour and sorrow, that my days should be consumed with shame?
